title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project scaffolding tool built with Next.js 14 using the Pages Router, TypeScript, and CSS, showcasing best practices for structuring a React application. It leverages MUI for UI components, React Query for efficient data fetching and management, and serves as a practical example for developers looking to quickly prototype and build robust applications with a modern tech stack.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their accumulated sleep debt. This repository provides a simple and interactive tool for tracking sleep patterns and highlighting the potential impact of sleep deprivation. It's a practical application showcasing the power of TypeScript in front-end development.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This project, built with HTML and Python, focuses on map visualization techniques. It explores methods to represent geographical data and insights through interactive and informative maps, serving as a practical example of data visualization principles and a learning resource for anyone interested in mapping projects.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project demonstrates a complete web application workflow, showcasing implementation of core functionalities like Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations while integrating database management and front-end design principles within a Python-based framework.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard built using Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example for learning and implementing dashboard layouts, component architecture, and data handling within the Next.js framework.

title: raven-v2
description: raven-v2 is a project leveraging TypeScript and JavaScript for its implementation. This repository houses the codebase for [briefly state project's purpose - e.g., a modern web application, a data analysis tool, etc.], aiming to [mention key functionality or goal - e.g., provide users with a streamlined experience, efficiently process large datasets, etc.]. It represents the second iteration of the project, building upon previous knowledge and incorporating modern development practices.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript for creating and managing voting applications. This repository contains the source code for a flexible voting platform, allowing users to easily create polls, cast votes, and view results. As a central project for learning and experimentation, it demonstrates best practices in modern web development utilizing these core technologies.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface for monitoring and controlling robotic fleets. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, this project allows users to visualize robot status, manage tasks, and interact with individual robots within the fleet. It serves as a comprehensive dashboard solution for managing and observing robotic deployments.

This project, built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, explores concepts and implementations related to [mention specific aspects of "project" if possible. If not, leave it vague]. It serves as a practical exercise and demonstration within the realm of web development.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: The dynamic-event-calendar repository provides a functional and visually appealing event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This project focuses on creating a dynamic and interactive calendar experience, allowing users to easily view, manage, and potentially add events, making it a valuable resource for learning front-end web development and exploring calendar implementations.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, utilizing Supabase for backend services and Tailwind CSS for styling. This repository provides a comprehensive solution for tracking IoT assets, demonstrating best practices in modern web development with a focus on clean architecture, robust data management, and responsive user interfaces.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for print-ready PDFs and HTML for an accessible online version. It serves as a project to showcase skills in document formatting, web development fundamentals, and version control, demonstrating the use of TeX and HTML to create a professional and versatile personal presentation.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project management application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help users organize, prioritize, and track their ideas from conception to completion. This repository houses the code for a dynamic and intuitive board interface, enabling efficient collaboration and streamlined project workflows. It focuses on improving personal and team project management capabilities.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project facilitates efficient debugging and understanding of ROS system behavior by providing an intuitive interface for filtering, searching, and inspecting log data. It is designed to improve ROS development workflows related to general project work.

title: genietalks
description: Genietalks is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, and HTML, leveraging ViteJS and ExpressJS to create a web application that interacts with the Gemini API. This repository showcases a practical implementation for integrating conversational AI capabilities into a modern web environment.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebooks and Python, contains projects exploring financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization. It serves as a practical resource for learning and applying Python to various finance-related tasks, covering topics such as portfolio optimization, time series analysis, and financial risk management.

title: atg-world
description: The `atg-world` repository houses a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It explores [mention the core function of the project if known, otherwise, be vague but indicative, e.g., interactive web development techniques, a specific application domain, data visualization], offering a hands-on exploration of [mention related topics to the core function or related topics, e.g., modern frontend frameworks, responsive design, dynamic data handling].

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is an e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (utilizing the pages router), TypeScript, and JavaScript, showcasing a type-safe approach to building a modern web application. It leverages MUI for UI components and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, providing a foundation for a robust and performant online store. This repository serves as a practical example of implementing e-commerce functionality with these technologies.
